text: The Jacqueline Kennedy Garden is located at the White House south of the East Colonnade. The garden balances the Rose Garden on the west side of the White House. The garden was named after First Lady Jackie Kennedy on 22 April 1965. ==Other websites== *History of the White House Gardens and Grounds *Additional pictures of the Rose Garden at the White House Museum Category:1965 establishments in the United States Category:Gardens Category:Buildings and structures in Washington, D.C.
title: Jacqueline Kennedy Garden
